hints.title: Bounded Velocity Variance Expansion from Cloning
hints.content:
6748: :label: thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
6749: 
6750: There exists a state-independent constant $C_v < \infty$ such that for any swarm $S$:
6751: 
6752: $$
6753: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},v}(S')] \leq V_{\text{Var},v}(S) + C_v
6754: $$
6755: 
6756: Equivalently, the one-step drift satisfies:
6757: 
6758: $$
6759: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
hints.raw_directive:
6745: We now prove that the velocity variance expansion from cloning is uniformly bounded.
6746: 
6747: :::{prf:theorem} Bounded Velocity Variance Expansion from Cloning
6748: :label: thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
6749: 
6750: There exists a state-independent constant $C_v < \infty$ such that for any swarm $S$:
6751: 
6752: $$
6753: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},v}(S')] \leq V_{\text{Var},v}(S) + C_v
6754: $$
6755: 
6756: Equivalently, the one-step drift satisfies:
6757: 
6758: $$
6759: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6760: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
hints.content:
6766: :::{prf:proof}
6767: :label: proof-thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
6768: **Proof.**
6769: 
6770: The proof analyzes how the inelastic collision model affects velocity variance.
6771: 
6772: **Step 1: Velocity domain boundedness**
6773: 
6774: By Axiom EG-4 (velocity regularization), all walker velocities in viable swarms satisfy:
6775: 
6776: $$
6777: \|v_i\| \leq V_{\max} := \sqrt{\max\left\{\frac{2F_{\max}}{\gamma}, V_{\text{thresh}}^2\right\}}
6778: $$
6779: 
6780: This bound is state-independent, depending only on physical parameters.
6781: 
6782: **Step 2: Per-walker velocity change**
6783: 
6784: When walker $i$ participates in an $(M+1)$-particle inelastic collision, its velocity changes from $v_i$ to:
6785: 
6786: $$
6787: v'_i = V_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{restitution}} \cdot R_i(u_i)
6788: $$
6789: 
6790: where $u_i = v_i - V_{\text{COM}}$ and $R_i$ is a random rotation.
6791: 
6792: The squared velocity change is bounded:
6793: 
6794: $$
6795: \|v'_i - v_i\|^2 = \|\alpha_{\text{restitution}} \cdot R_i(u_i) - u_i\|^2 \leq (\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 \|u_i\|^2
6796: $$
6797: 
6798: Since $\|u_i\| \leq 2V_{\max}$ (difference of two bounded velocities):
6799: 
6800: $$
6801: \|v'_i - v_i\|^2 \leq 4(\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 V_{\max}^2
6802: $$
6803: 
6804: **Step 3: Variance change decomposition**
6805: 
6806: The velocity variance changes due to:
6807: 
6808: 1. **Direct velocity resets** for cloned walkers (bounded by Step 2)
6809: 2. **Barycenter shift** affecting centered velocities (bounded by total momentum conservation)
6810: 3. **Random rotations** redistributing kinetic energy (bounded by elastic limit)
6811: 
6812: Each contribution is bounded by constants depending only on $V_{\max}$, $\alpha_{\text{restitution}}$, and $N$.
6813: 
6814: **Step 4: Total bounded expansion**
6815: 
6816: Summing over all walkers and using $N$-normalization:
6817: 
6818: $$
6819: \mathbb{E}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N p_i \cdot 4(\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 V_{\max}^2 + C_{\text{bary}}
6820: $$
6821: 
6822: Since $p_i \in [0,1]$ and $\sum_i p_i \leq N$ (at most all walkers clone):
6823: 
6824: $$
6825: \mathbb{E}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq 4(\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 V_{\max}^2 + C_{\text{bary}} =: C_v
6826: $$
6827: 
6828: This constant is **state-independent** and **$N$-independent** (the $N$ cancels in the normalization).

hints.label: rem-synergistic-velocity-dissipation
hints.title: Synergistic Dissipation Enables Net Contraction
hints.content:
6834: :label: rem-synergistic-velocity-dissipation
6835: 
6836: This bounded expansion is the prerequisite for the synergistic dissipation framework. The companion document will prove that the kinetic operator provides velocity contraction:
6837: 
6838: $$
6839: \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_v V_{\text{Var},v} + C'_v
6840: $$
6841: 
6842: for some $\kappa_v > 0$ proportional to the Langevin friction $\gamma$.
6843: 
6844: When properly balanced:
6845: 
6846: $$
6847: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone} \circ \text{kin}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_v V_{\text{Var},v} + (C_v + C'_v)
6848: $$
